Class App

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse216.rdm325.backend.App
  • public class App
extends java.lang.Object
    For now, our app creates an HTTP server that can only get and add data.

    • Method Detail

      • handleGetMessagesRequest

        public static java.lang.String handleGetMessagesRequest​(Request request,
                                                        Response response)
        GET route that returns all message subjects and Ids. All we do is get the data, embed it in a StructuredResponse, turn it into JSON, and return it. If there's no data, we return "[]", so there's no need for error handling.

      • handleGetCommentsRequest

        public static java.lang.String handleGetCommentsRequest​(Request request,
                                                        Response response)
        GET route that returns all comments for a given post. All we do is get the data, embed it in a StructuredResponse, turn it into JSON, and return it. If there's no data, we return "[]", so there's no need for error handling.

      • handleCommentsCountRequest

        public static java.lang.String handleCommentsCountRequest​(Request request,
                                                          Response response)
        GET route that returns the count of all comments for a given post. All we do is get the data, embed it in a StructuredResponse, turn it into JSON, and return it. If there's no data, we return "[]", so there's no need for error handling.

      • handleGetMessageRequest

        public static java.lang.String handleGetMessageRequest​(Request request,
                                                       Response response)
        GET route that returns everything for a single row in the DataRowMessage. The ":id" suffix in the first parameter to get() becomes request.params("id"), so that we can get the requested row ID. If ":id" isn't a number, Spark will reply with a status 500 Internal Server Error. Otherwise, we have an integer, and the only possible error is that it doesn't correspond to a row with data.

      • handleGetCommentRequest

        public static java.lang.String handleGetCommentRequest​(Request request,
                                                       Response response)
        GET route that returns everything for a single row in the DataRowComment. The ":id" suffix in the first parameter to get() becomes request.params("id"), so that we can get the requested row ID. If ":id" isn't a number, Spark will reply with a status 500 Internal Server Error. Otherwise, we have an integer, and the only possible error is that it doesn't correspond to a row with data.

      • handleGetUserRequest

        public static java.lang.String handleGetUserRequest​(Request request,
                                                    Response response)
        GET route that returns everything for a single row in the DataRowUser. The ":id" suffix in the first parameter to get() becomes request.params("id"), so that we can get the requested row ID. If ":id" isn't a number, Spark will reply with a status 500 Internal Server Error. Otherwise, we have an integer, and the only possible error is that it doesn't correspond to a row with data.

      • handleGetUpvoteRequest

        public static java.lang.String handleGetUpvoteRequest​(Request request,
                                                      Response response)
        GET route that returns everything for a single row in the DataRowUpvote. The ":mid" suffix in the first parameter to get() becomes request.params("mid"), so that we can get the requested row ID. If ":mid" isn't a number, Spark will reply with a status 500 Internal Server Error. Otherwise, we have an integer, and the only possible error is that it doesn't correspond to a row with data.

      • handleGetDownvoteRequest

        public static java.lang.String handleGetDownvoteRequest​(Request request,
                                                        Response response)
        GET route that returns everything for a single row in the DataRowDownvote. The ":mid" suffix in the first parameter to get() becomes request.params("mid"), so that we can get the requested row ID. If ":mid" isn't a number, Spark will reply with a status 500 Internal Server Error. Otherwise, we have an integer, and the only possible error is that it doesn't correspond to a row with data.

      • handlePostMessageRequest

        public static java.lang.String handlePostMessageRequest​(Request request,
                                                        Response response)
        POST route for adding a new element to the DataRowMessage. This will read JSON from the body of the request, turn it into a SimpleRequestMessage object, extract the subject and message, insert them, and return the ID of the newly created row.

      • handlePostCommentRequest

        public static java.lang.String handlePostCommentRequest​(Request request,
                                                        Response response)
        POST route for adding a new element to the DataRowComment. This will read JSON from the body of the request, turn it into a SimpleRequestComment object, extract the subject and message, insert them, and return the ID of the newly created row.

      • handlePostUpvoteRequest

        public static java.lang.String handlePostUpvoteRequest​(Request request,
                                                       Response response)
        POST route for adding a new element to the upvote table. This will not read JSON from the body of the request, instead it creates based in the uid and mid of the request and returning if it was a success or not.

      • handlePostDownvoteRequest

        public static java.lang.String handlePostDownvoteRequest​(Request request,
                                                         Response response)
        POST route for adding a new element to the downvote table. This will not read JSON from the body of the request, instead it creates based in the uid and mid of the request and returning if it was a success or not.

      • handleCommentContentEdit

        public static java.lang.String handleCommentContentEdit​(Request request,
                                                        Response response)
        PUT route for updating a row in the DataRowComment. Edits the message content of the comment itself Only the comment creator and the admin can edit their comment

      • handleCommentFileEdit

        public static java.lang.String handleCommentFileEdit​(Request request,
                                                     Response response)
        PUT route for updating a row in the DataRowComment. Edits the file content of the comment. Only the comment creator and the admin can edit their comment

      • handleCommentLinkEdit

        public static java.lang.String handleCommentLinkEdit​(Request request,
                                                     Response response)
        PUT route for updating a row in the DataRowComment. Edits the link/url content of the comment. Only the comment creator and the admin can edit their comment

      • handleNameEdit

        public static java.lang.String handleNameEdit​(Request request,
                                              Response response)
        PUT route for updating a name in a DataRowUser. This is almost exactly the same as POST but with it updates an existing element. Only the comment creator and the admin can edit their comment

      • handleUserEmailEdit

        public static java.lang.String handleUserEmailEdit​(Request request,
                                                   Response response)
        PUT route for updating a email in a DataRowUser. This is almost exactly the same as POST but with it updates an existing element. Only the comment creator and the admin can edit their comment

      • handleUserGenderEdit

        public static java.lang.String handleUserGenderEdit​(Request request,
                                                    Response response)
        PUT route for updating a gender in a DataRowUser. This is almost exactly the same as POST but with it updates an existing element. Only the comment creator and the admin can edit their comment

      • handleUserSoEdit

        public static java.lang.String handleUserSoEdit​(Request request,
                                                Response response)
        PUT route for updating a so in a DataRowUser. This is almost exactly the same as POST but with it updates an existing element. Only the comment creator and the admin can edit their comment

      • handleUsernameEdit

        public static java.lang.String handleUsernameEdit​(Request request,
                                                  Response response)
        PUT route for updating a username in a DataRowUser. This is almost exactly the same as POST but with it updates an existing element. Only the comment creator and the admin can edit their comment

      • handleUserNoteEdit

        public static java.lang.String handleUserNoteEdit​(Request request,
                                                  Response response)
        PUT route for updating a note in a DataRowUser. This is almost exactly the same as POST but with it updates an existing element. Only the comment creator and the admin can edit their comment

      • handleUserPost

        public static java.lang.String handleUserPost​(Request request,
                                              Response response)
        POST route for adding a new element to the DataRowUser. This will read JSON from the body of the request, turn it into a SimpleRequestUser object, extract the subject and message, insert them, and return the ID of the newly created row. It will also insert them into the cache.

      • handleUpvoteDelete

        public static java.lang.String handleUpvoteDelete​(Request request,
                                                  Response response)
        DELETE route for removing a row from the upvotes table

      • handleDownvoteDelete

        public static java.lang.String handleDownvoteDelete​(Request request,
                                                    Response response)
        DELETE route for removing a row from the downvotes table

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Runs the backend

        args - main() args
